meanings.definition: A person who resides or has possession of a place.
meanings.sent1: The occupiers of the house were friendly neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The occupiers of the apartment complex organized a community event.
meanings.sent3: The occupiers of the cabin had a surprise party for the owner.
meanings.sent4: The occupiers of the dormitory created a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The occupiers of the mansion kept the garden beautiful.

meanings.definition: A group of people who have taken control of a building or land.
meanings.sent1: The occupiers of the warehouse protested for better working conditions.
meanings.sent2: The occupiers of the park cleaned up the litter left by others.
meanings.sent3: The occupiers of the castle threw a medieval-themed party.
meanings.sent4: The occupiers of the farm worked together to harvest the crops.
meanings.sent5: The occupiers of the stadium cheered loudly for their team.

meanings.definition: The act of taking control or possession of a place.
meanings.sent1: The sudden occupiers of the office caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent2: The peaceful occupiers of the beach enjoyed the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected occupiers of the park turned out to be friendly campers.
meanings.sent4: The temporary occupiers of the classroom left behind their textbooks.
meanings.sent5: The rightful occupiers of the land reclaimed their territory.
